  16. open Clflags

  18. exception Exit_with_status of int

  20. ‌let output_prefix name =
  21.   let oname =
  22.     match !output_name with
  23.     | None -> name
  24.     | Some n -> if !compile_only then (output_name := None; n) else name in
  25.   Filename.remove_extension oname

  27. ‌let print_version_and_library compiler =
  28.   Printf.printf "The OCaml %s, version " compiler;
  29.   print_string Config.version; print_newline();
  30.   print_string "Standard library directory: ";
  31.   print_string Config.standard_library; print_newline();
  32.   raise (Exit_with_status 0)

  34. ‌let print_version_string () =
  35.   print_string Config.version; print_newline();
  36.   raise (Exit_with_status 0)

  38. ‌let print_standard_library () =
  39.   print_string Config.standard_library; print_newline();
  40.   raise (Exit_with_status 0)

  42. ‌let fatal err =
  43.   prerr_endline err;
  44.   raise (Exit_with_status 2)

  46. ‌let extract_output = function
  47.   | Some s -> s
  48.   | None ->
  49.       fatal "Please specify the name of the output file, using option -o"

  51. ‌let default_output = function
  52.   | Some s -> s
  53.   | None -> Config.default_executable_name

  55. ‌let first_include_dirs = ref []
  56. ‌let last_include_dirs = ref []
  57. ‌let first_ccopts = ref []
  58. ‌let last_ccopts = ref []
  59. ‌let first_ppx = ref []
  60. ‌let last_ppx = ref []
  61. ‌let first_objfiles = ref []
  62. ‌let last_objfiles = ref []
  63. ‌let stop_early = ref false

  65. (* Check validity of module name *)
  66. ‌let is_unit_name name =
  67.   try
  68.     if name = "" then raise Exit;
  69.     begin match name.[0] with
  70.     | 'A'..'Z' -> ()
  71.     | _ ->
  72.        raise Exit;
  73.     end;
  74.     for i = 1 to String.length name - 1 do
  75.       match name.[i] with
  76.       | 'A'..'Z' | 'a'..'z' | '0'..'9' | '_' | '\'' -> ()
  77.       | _ ->
  78.          raise Exit;
  79.     done;
  80.     true
  81.   with Exit -> false

  83. ‌let check_unit_name filename name =
  84.   if not (is_unit_name name) then
  85.     Location.prerr_warning (Location.in_file filename)
  86.       (Warnings.Bad_module_name name)

  88. (* Compute name of module from output file name *)
  89. ‌let module_of_filename inputfile outputprefix =
  90.   let basename = Filename.basename outputprefix in
  91.   let name =
  92.     try
  93.       let pos = String.index basename '.' in
  94.       String.sub basename 0 pos
  95.     with Not_found -> basename
  96.   in
  97.   let name = String.capitalize_ascii name in
  98.   check_unit_name inputfile name;
  99.   name

  101. ‌type filename = string

  103. ‌type readenv_position =
  104.   Before_args | Before_compile of filename | Before_link

  106. (* Syntax of OCAMLPARAM: SEP?(name=VALUE SEP)* _ (SEP name=VALUE)*
  107.    where VALUE should not contain SEP, and SEP is ',' if unspecified,
  108.    or ':', '|', ';', ' ' or ',' *)
  109. exception SyntaxError of string

  111. ‌let print_error ppf msg =
  112.   Location.print_warning Location.none ppf
  113.     (Warnings.Bad_env_variable ("OCAMLPARAM", msg))

  115. ‌let parse_args s =
  116.   let args =
  117.     let len = String.length s in
  118.     if len = 0 then []
  119.     else
  120.       (* allow first char to specify an alternative separator in ":|; ," *)
  121.       match s.[0] with
  122.       | ( ':' | '|' | ';' | ' ' | ',' ) as c ->
  123.          List.tl (String.split_on_char c s)
  124.       | _ -> String.split_on_char ',' s
  125.   in
  126. ‌  let rec iter is_after args before after =
  127.     match args with
  128.       [] ->
  129.       if not is_after then
  130.         raise (SyntaxError "no '_' separator found")
  131.       else
  132.         (List.rev before, List.rev after)
  133.     | "" :: tail -> iter is_after tail before after
  134.     | "_" :: _ when is_after -> raise (SyntaxError "too many '_' separators")
  135.     | "_" :: tail -> iter true tail before after
  136.     | arg :: tail ->
  137.       let binding = try
  138.         Misc.cut_at arg '='
  139.       with Not_found ->
  140.         raise (SyntaxError ("missing '=' in " ^ arg))
  141.       in
  142.       if is_after then
  143.         iter is_after tail before (binding :: after)
  144.       else
  145.         iter is_after tail (binding :: before) after
  146.   in
  147.   iter false args [] []

  149. ‌let setter ppf f name options s =
  150.   try
  151.     let bool = match s with
  152.       | "0" -> false
  153.       | "1" -> true
  154.       | _ -> raise Not_found
  155.     in
  156.     List.iter (fun b -> b := f bool) options
  157.   with Not_found ->
  158.     Printf.ksprintf (print_error ppf)
  159.       "bad value %s for %s" s name

  161. ‌let int_setter ppf name option s =
  162.   try
  163.     option := int_of_string s
  164.   with _ ->
  165.     Printf.ksprintf (print_error ppf)
  166.       "non-integer parameter %s for %S" s name

  168. ‌let int_option_setter ppf name option s =
  169.   try
  170.     option := Some (int_of_string s)
  171.   with _ ->
  172.     Printf.ksprintf (print_error ppf)
  173.       "non-integer parameter %s for %S" s name

  175. (*
  176. let float_setter ppf name option s =
  177.   try
  178.     option := float_of_string s
  179.   with _ ->
  180.     Location.print_warning Location.none ppf
  181.       (Warnings.Bad_env_variable
  182.          ("OCAMLPARAM", Printf.sprintf "non-float parameter for \"%s\"" name))
  183. *)

  185. ‌let check_bool ppf name s =
  186.   match s with
  187.   | "0" -> false
  188.   | "1" -> true
  189.   | _ ->
  190.     Printf.ksprintf (print_error ppf)
  191.       "bad value %s for %s" s name;
  192.     false

  194. ‌let decode_compiler_pass ppf v ~name ~filter =
  195.   let module P = Clflags.Compiler_pass in
  196. ‌  let passes = P.available_pass_names ~filter ~native:!native_code in
  197.   begin match List.find_opt (String.equal v) passes with
  198.   | None ->
  199.     Printf.ksprintf (print_error ppf)
  200.       "bad value %s for option \"%s\" (expected one of: %s)"
  201.       v name (String.concat ", " passes);
  202.     None
  203.   | Some v -> P.of_string v
  204.   end

  206. ‌let set_compiler_pass ppf ~name v flag ~filter =
  207.   match decode_compiler_pass ppf v ~name ~filter with
  208.   | None -> ()
  209.   | Some pass ->
  210.     match !flag with
  211.     | None -> flag := Some pass
  212.     | Some p ->
  213.       if not (p = pass) then begin
  214.         Printf.ksprintf (print_error ppf)
  215.           "Please specify at most one %s <pass>." name
  216.       end

  218. (* 'can-discard=' specifies which arguments can be discarded without warning
  219.    because they are not understood by some versions of OCaml. *)
  220. let can_discard = ref []

  222. ‌let parse_warnings error v =
  223.   Option.iter Location.(prerr_alert none) @@ Warnings.parse_options error v

  225. ‌let read_one_param ppf position name v =
  226.   let set name options s =  setter ppf (fun b -> b) name options s in
  227.   let clear name options s = setter ppf (fun b -> not b) name options s in
  228.   let compat name s =
  229.     let error_if_unset = function
  230.       | true -> true
  231.       | false ->
  232.         Printf.ksprintf (print_error ppf)
  233.           "Unsetting %s is not supported anymore" name;
  234.         true
  235.     in
  236.     setter ppf error_if_unset name [ ref true ] s
  237.   in
  238.   match name with
  239.   | "g" -> set "g" [ Clflags.debug ] v
  240.   | "bin-annot" -> set "bin-annot" [ Clflags.binary_annotations ] v
  241.   | "afl-instrument" -> set "afl-instrument" [ Clflags.afl_instrument ] v
  242.   | "afl-inst-ratio" ->
  243.       int_setter ppf "afl-inst-ratio" afl_inst_ratio v
  244.   | "annot" -> set "annot" [ Clflags.annotations ] v
  245.   | "absname" -> set "absname" [ Clflags.absname ] v
  246.   | "compat-32" -> set "compat-32" [ bytecode_compatible_32 ] v
  247.   | "noassert" -> set "noassert" [ noassert ] v
  248.   | "noautolink" -> set "noautolink" [ no_auto_link ] v
  249.   | "nostdlib" -> set "nostdlib" [ no_std_include ] v
  250.   | "nocwd" -> set "nocwd" [ no_cwd ] v
  251.   | "linkall" -> set "linkall" [ link_everything ] v
  252.   | "nolabels" -> set "nolabels" [ classic ] v
  253.   | "principal" -> set "principal"  [ principal ] v
  254.   | "rectypes" -> set "rectypes" [ recursive_types ] v
  255.   | "safe-string" -> compat "safe-string" v (* kept for compatibility *)
  256.   | "strict-sequence" -> set "strict-sequence" [ strict_sequence ] v
  257.   | "strict-formats" -> set "strict-formats" [ strict_formats ] v
  258.   | "thread" -> set "thread" [ use_threads ] v
  259.   | "unboxed-types" -> set "unboxed-types" [ unboxed_types ] v
  260.   | "unsafe" -> set "unsafe" [ unsafe ] v
  261.   | "verbose" -> set "verbose" [ verbose ] v
  262.   | "nopervasives" -> set "nopervasives" [ nopervasives ] v
  263.   | "slash" -> set "slash" [ force_slash ] v (* for ocamldep *)
  264.   | "no-slash" -> clear "no-slash" [ force_slash ] v (* for ocamldep *)
  265.   | "keep-docs" -> set "keep-docs" [ Clflags.keep_docs ] v
  266.   | "keep-locs" -> set "keep-locs" [ Clflags.keep_locs ] v

  268.   | "compact" -> clear "compact" [ optimize_for_speed ] v
  269.   | "no-app-funct" -> clear "no-app-funct" [ applicative_functors ] v
  270.   | "nodynlink" -> clear "nodynlink" [ dlcode ] v
  271.   | "short-paths" -> clear "short-paths" [ real_paths ] v
  272.   | "trans-mod" -> set "trans-mod" [ transparent_modules ] v
  273.   | "opaque" -> set "opaque" [ opaque ] v

  275.   | "pp" -> preprocessor := Some v
  276.   | "runtime-variant" -> runtime_variant := v
  277.   | "with-runtime" -> set "with-runtime" [ with_runtime ] v
  278.   | "open" ->
  279.       open_modules := List.rev_append (String.split_on_char ',' v) !open_modules
  280.   | "cc" -> c_compiler := Some v

  282.   | "clambda-checks" -> set "clambda-checks" [ clambda_checks ] v

  284.   | "function-sections" ->
  285.     set "function-sections" [ Clflags.function_sections ] v
  286.   (* assembly sources *)
  287.   |  "s" ->
  288.     set "s" [ Clflags.keep_asm_file ; Clflags.keep_startup_file ] v
  289.   |  "S" -> set "S" [ Clflags.keep_asm_file ] v
  290.   |  "dstartup" -> set "dstartup" [ Clflags.keep_startup_file ] v

  292.   (* warn-errors *)
  293.   | "we" | "warn-error" -> parse_warnings true v
  294.   (* warnings *)
  295.   |  "w"  ->               parse_warnings false v
  296.   (* warn-errors *)
  297.   | "wwe" ->               parse_warnings false v
  298.   (* alerts *)
  299.   | "alert" ->             Warnings.parse_alert_option v

  301.   (* inlining *)
  302.   | "inline" ->
  303.       let module F = Float_arg_helper in
  304.       begin match F.parse_no_error v inline_threshold with
  305.       | F.Ok -> ()
  306.       | F.Parse_failed exn ->
  307.           Printf.ksprintf (print_error ppf)
  308.             "bad syntax %s for \"inline\": %s" v (Printexc.to_string exn)
  309.       end

  311.   | "inline-toplevel" ->
  312.     Int_arg_helper.parse v
  313.       "Bad syntax in OCAMLPARAM for 'inline-toplevel'"
  314.       inline_toplevel_threshold

  316.   | "rounds" -> int_option_setter ppf "rounds" simplify_rounds v
  317.   | "inline-max-unroll" ->
  318.     Int_arg_helper.parse v "Bad syntax in OCAMLPARAM for 'inline-max-unroll'"
  319.       inline_max_unroll
  320.   | "inline-call-cost" ->
  321.     Int_arg_helper.parse v
  322.       "Bad syntax in OCAMLPARAM for 'inline-call-cost'"
  323.       inline_call_cost
  324.   | "inline-alloc-cost" ->
  325.     Int_arg_helper.parse v
  326.       "Bad syntax in OCAMLPARAM for 'inline-alloc-cost'"
  327.       inline_alloc_cost
  328.   | "inline-prim-cost" ->
  329.     Int_arg_helper.parse v
  330.       "Bad syntax in OCAMLPARAM for 'inline-prim-cost'"
  331.       inline_prim_cost
  332.   | "inline-branch-cost" ->
  333.     Int_arg_helper.parse v
  334.       "Bad syntax in OCAMLPARAM for 'inline-branch-cost'"
  335.       inline_branch_cost
  336.   | "inline-indirect-cost" ->
  337.     Int_arg_helper.parse v
  338.       "Bad syntax in OCAMLPARAM for 'inline-indirect-cost'"
  339.       inline_indirect_cost
  340.   | "inline-lifting-benefit" ->
  341.     Int_arg_helper.parse v
  342.       "Bad syntax in OCAMLPARAM for 'inline-lifting-benefit'"
  343.       inline_lifting_benefit
  344.   | "inline-branch-factor" ->
  345.     Float_arg_helper.parse v
  346.       "Bad syntax in OCAMLPARAM for 'inline-branch-factor'"
  347.       inline_branch_factor
  348.   | "inline-max-depth" ->
  349.     Int_arg_helper.parse v
  350.       "Bad syntax in OCAMLPARAM for 'inline-max-depth'"
  351.       inline_max_depth

  353.   | "Oclassic" ->
  354.       set "Oclassic" [ classic_inlining ] v
  355.   | "O2" ->
  356.     if check_bool ppf "O2" v then begin
  357.       default_simplify_rounds := 2;
  358.       use_inlining_arguments_set o2_arguments;
  359.       use_inlining_arguments_set ~round:0 o1_arguments
  360.     end

  362.   | "O3" ->
  363.     if check_bool ppf "O3" v then begin
  364.       default_simplify_rounds := 3;
  365.       use_inlining_arguments_set o3_arguments;
  366.       use_inlining_arguments_set ~round:1 o2_arguments;
  367.       use_inlining_arguments_set ~round:0 o1_arguments
  368.     end
  369.   | "unbox-closures" ->
  370.       set "unbox-closures" [ unbox_closures ] v
  371.   | "unbox-closures-factor" ->
  372.       int_setter ppf "unbox-closures-factor" unbox_closures_factor v
  373.   | "remove-unused-arguments" ->
  374.       set "remove-unused-arguments" [ remove_unused_arguments ] v

  376.   | "inlining-report" ->
  377.       if !native_code then
  378.         set "inlining-report" [ inlining_report ] v

  380.   | "flambda-verbose" ->
  381.       set "flambda-verbose" [ dump_flambda_verbose ] v
  382.   | "flambda-invariants" ->
  383.       set "flambda-invariants" [ flambda_invariant_checks ] v
  384.   | "cmm-invariants" ->
  385.       set "cmm-invariants" [ cmm_invariants ] v
  386.   | "linscan" ->
  387.       set "linscan" [ use_linscan ] v
  388.   | "insn-sched" -> set "insn-sched" [ insn_sched ] v
  389.   | "no-insn-sched" -> clear "insn-sched" [ insn_sched ] v

  391.   (* color output *)
  392.   | "color" ->
  393.       begin match color_reader.parse v with
  394.       | None ->
  395.         Printf.ksprintf (print_error ppf)
  396.           "bad value %s for \"color\", (%s)" v color_reader.usage
  397.       | Some setting -> color := Some setting
  398.       end

  400.   | "error-style" ->
  401.       begin match error_style_reader.parse v with
  402.       | None ->
  403.           Printf.ksprintf (print_error ppf)
  404.             "bad value %s for \"error-style\", (%s)" v error_style_reader.usage
  405.       | Some setting -> error_style := Some setting
  406.       end

  408.   | "intf-suffix" -> Config.interface_suffix := v

  410.   | "I" -> begin
  411.       match position with
  412.       | Before_args -> first_include_dirs := v :: !first_include_dirs
  413.       | Before_link | Before_compile _ ->
  414.         last_include_dirs := v :: !last_include_dirs
  415.     end

  417.   | "cclib" ->
  418.     begin
  419.       match position with
  420.       | Before_compile _ -> ()
  421.       | Before_link | Before_args ->
  422.         ccobjs := Misc.rev_split_words v @ !ccobjs
  423.     end

  425.   | "ccopt"
  426.   | "ccopts"
  427.     ->
  428.     begin
  429.       match position with
  430.       | Before_link | Before_compile _ ->
  431.         last_ccopts := v :: !last_ccopts
  432.       | Before_args ->
  433.         first_ccopts := v :: !first_ccopts
  434.     end

  436.   | "ppx" ->
  437.     begin
  438.       match position with
  439.       | Before_link | Before_compile _ ->
  440.         last_ppx := v :: !last_ppx
  441.       | Before_args ->
  442.         first_ppx := v :: !first_ppx
  443.     end


  446.   | "cmo" | "cma" ->
  447.     if not !native_code then
  448.     begin
  449.       match position with
  450.       | Before_link | Before_compile _ ->
  451.         last_objfiles := v ::! last_objfiles
  452.       | Before_args ->
  453.         first_objfiles := v :: !first_objfiles
  454.     end

  456.   | "cmx" | "cmxa" ->
  457.     if !native_code then
  458.     begin
  459.       match position with
  460.       | Before_link | Before_compile _ ->
  461.         last_objfiles := v ::! last_objfiles
  462.       | Before_args ->
  463.         first_objfiles := v :: !first_objfiles
  464.     end

  466.   | "pic" ->
  467.     if !native_code then
  468.       set "pic" [ pic_code ] v

  470.   | "can-discard" ->
  471.     can_discard := v ::!can_discard

  473.   | "timings" | "profile" ->
  474. ‌     let if_on = if name = "timings" then [ `Time ] else Profile.all_columns in
  475.      profile_columns := if check_bool ppf name v then if_on else []

  477.   | "stop-after" ->
  478.     set_compiler_pass ppf v ~name Clflags.stop_after ~filter:(fun _ -> true)

  480.   | "save-ir-after" ->
  481.     if !native_code then begin
  482. ‌      let filter = Clflags.Compiler_pass.can_save_ir_after in
  483.       match decode_compiler_pass ppf v ~name ~filter with
  484.       | None -> ()
  485.       | Some pass -> set_save_ir_after pass true
  486.     end
  487.   | "dump-into-file" -> Clflags.dump_into_file := true
  488.   | "dump-dir" -> Clflags.dump_dir := Some v

  490.   | _ ->
  491.     if not (List.mem name !can_discard) then begin
  492.       can_discard := name :: !can_discard;
  493.       Printf.ksprintf (print_error ppf)
  494.         "Warning: discarding value of variable %S in OCAMLPARAM\n%!"
  495.         name
  496.     end


  499. ‌let read_OCAMLPARAM ppf position =
  500.   try
  501.     let s = Sys.getenv "OCAMLPARAM" in
  502.     if s <> "" then
  503.       let (before, after) =
  504.         try
  505.           parse_args s
  506.         with SyntaxError s ->
  507.           print_error ppf s;
  508.           [],[]
  509.       in
  510.       List.iter (fun (name, v) -> read_one_param ppf position name v)
  511.         (match position with
  512.            Before_args -> before
  513.          | Before_compile _ | Before_link -> after)
  514.   with Not_found -> ()

  516. (* OCAMLPARAM passed as file *)

  518. ‌type pattern =
  519.   | Filename of string
  520.   | Any

  522. ‌type file_option = {
  523.   pattern : pattern;
  524.   name : string;
  525.   value : string;
  526. }

  528. ‌let scan_line ic =
  529.   Scanf.bscanf ic "%[0-9a-zA-Z_.*] : %[a-zA-Z_-] = %s "
  530.     (fun pattern name value ->
  531.        let pattern =
  532.          match pattern with
  533.          | "*" -> Any
  534.          | _ -> Filename pattern
  535.        in
  536.        { pattern; name; value })

  538. let load_config ppf filename =
  539.   match open_in_bin filename with
  540.   | exception e ->
  541.       Location.errorf ~loc:(Location.in_file filename)
  542.         "Cannot open file %s" (Printexc.to_string e)
  543.       |> Location.print_report ppf;
  544.       raise Exit
  545.   | ic ->
  546.       let sic = Scanf.Scanning.from_channel ic in
  547.       let rec read line_number line_start acc =
  548.         match scan_line sic with
  549.         | exception End_of_file ->
  550.             close_in ic;
  551.             acc
  552.         | exception Scanf.Scan_failure error ->
  553.             let position = Lexing.{
  554.                 pos_fname = filename;
  555.                 pos_lnum = line_number;
  556.                 pos_bol = line_start;
  557.                 pos_cnum = pos_in ic;
  558.               }
  559.             in
  560.             let loc = Location.{
  561.                 loc_start = position;
  562.                 loc_end = position;
  563.                 loc_ghost = false;
  564.               }
  565.             in
  566.             Location.errorf ~loc "Configuration file error %s" error
  567.             |> Location.print_report ppf;
  568.             close_in ic;
  569.             raise Exit
  570.         | line ->
  571.             read (line_number + 1) (pos_in ic) (line :: acc)
  572.       in
  573.       let lines = read 0 0 [] in
  574.       lines

  576. let matching_filename filename { pattern } =
  577.   match pattern with
  578.   | Any -> true
  579.   | Filename pattern ->
  580.     let filename = String.lowercase_ascii filename in
  581.     let pattern = String.lowercase_ascii pattern in
  582.     filename = pattern

  584. let apply_config_file ppf position =
  585.   let config_file =
  586.     Filename.concat Config.standard_library "ocaml_compiler_internal_params"
  587.   in
  588.   let config =
  589.     if Sys.file_exists config_file then
  590.       load_config ppf config_file
  591.     else
  592.       []
  593.   in
  594.   let config =
  595.     match position with
  596.     | Before_compile filename ->
  597.       List.filter (matching_filename filename) config
  598.     | Before_args | Before_link ->
  599.       List.filter (fun { pattern } -> pattern = Any) config
  600.   in
  601.   List.iter (fun { name; value } -> read_one_param ppf position name value)
  602.     config

  604. let readenv ppf position =
  605.   last_include_dirs := [];
  606.   last_ccopts := [];
  607.   last_ppx := [];
  608.   last_objfiles := [];
  609.   apply_config_file ppf position;
  610.   read_OCAMLPARAM ppf position;
  611.   all_ccopts := !last_ccopts @ !first_ccopts;
  612.   all_ppx := !last_ppx @ !first_ppx

  614. let get_objfiles ~with_ocamlparam =
  615.   if with_ocamlparam then
  616.     List.rev (!last_objfiles @ !objfiles @ !first_objfiles)
  617.   else
  618.     List.rev !objfiles

  620. let has_linker_inputs = ref false





  626. type deferred_action =
  627.   | ProcessImplementation of string
  628.   | ProcessInterface of string
  629.   | ProcessCFile of string
  630.   | ProcessOtherFile of string
  631.   | ProcessObjects of string list
  632.   | ProcessDLLs of string list

  634. let c_object_of_filename name =
  635.   Filename.chop_suffix (Filename.basename name) ".c" ^ Config.ext_obj

  637. let process_action
  638.     (ppf, implementation, interface, ocaml_mod_ext, ocaml_lib_ext) action =
  639.   let impl ~start_from name =
  640.     readenv ppf (Before_compile name);
  641.     let opref = output_prefix name in
  642.     implementation ~start_from ~source_file:name ~output_prefix:opref;
  643.     objfiles := (opref ^ ocaml_mod_ext) :: !objfiles
  644.   in
  645.   match action with
  646.   | ProcessImplementation name ->
  647.       impl ~start_from:Compiler_pass.Parsing name
  648.   | ProcessInterface name ->
  649.       readenv ppf (Before_compile name);
  650.       let opref = output_prefix name in
  651.       interface ~source_file:name ~output_prefix:opref;
  652.       if !make_package then objfiles := (opref ^ ".cmi") :: !objfiles
  653.   | ProcessCFile name ->
  654.       readenv ppf (Before_compile name);
  655.       Location.input_name := name;
  656.       let obj_name = match !output_name with
  657.         | None -> c_object_of_filename name
  658.         | Some n -> n
  659.       in
  660.       if Ccomp.compile_file ?output:!output_name name <> 0
  661.       then raise (Exit_with_status 2);
  662.       ccobjs := obj_name :: !ccobjs
  663.   | ProcessObjects names ->
  664.       ccobjs := names @ !ccobjs
  665.   | ProcessDLLs names ->
  666.       dllibs := names @ !dllibs
  667.   | ProcessOtherFile name ->
  668.       if Filename.check_suffix name ocaml_mod_ext
  669.       || Filename.check_suffix name ocaml_lib_ext then
  670.         objfiles := name :: !objfiles
  671.       else if Filename.check_suffix name ".cmi" && !make_package then
  672.         objfiles := name :: !objfiles
  673.       else if Filename.check_suffix name Config.ext_obj
  674.            || Filename.check_suffix name Config.ext_lib then begin
  675.         has_linker_inputs := true;
  676.         ccobjs := name :: !ccobjs
  677.       end
  678.       else if not !native_code && Filename.check_suffix name Config.ext_dll then
  679.         dllibs := name :: !dllibs
  680.       else
  681.         match Compiler_pass.of_input_filename name with
  682.         | Some start_from ->
  683.           Location.input_name := name;
  684.           impl ~start_from name
  685.         | None -> raise(Arg.Bad("don't know what to do with " ^ name))


  688. ‌let action_of_file name =
  689.   if Filename.check_suffix name ".ml"
  690.   || Filename.check_suffix name ".mlt" then
  691.     ProcessImplementation name
  692.   else if Filename.check_suffix name !Config.interface_suffix then
  693.     ProcessInterface name
  694.   else if Filename.check_suffix name ".c" then
  695.     ProcessCFile name
  696.   else
  697.     ProcessOtherFile name

  699. ‌let deferred_actions = ref []
  700. ‌let defer action =
  701.   deferred_actions := action :: !deferred_actions

  703. ‌let anonymous filename = defer (action_of_file filename)
  704. ‌let impl filename = defer (ProcessImplementation filename)
  705. ‌let intf filename = defer (ProcessInterface filename)

  707. ‌let process_deferred_actions env =
  708.   let final_output_name = !output_name in
  709.   (* Make sure the intermediate products don't clash with the final one
  710.      when we're invoked like: ocamlopt -o foo bar.c baz.ml. *)
  711.   if not !compile_only then output_name := None;
  712.   begin
  713.     match final_output_name with
  714.     | None -> ()
  715.     | Some _output_name ->
  716.         if !compile_only then begin
  717.           if List.length (List.filter (function
  718.               | ProcessCFile _
  719.               | ProcessImplementation _
  720.               | ProcessInterface _ -> true
  721.               | _ -> false) !deferred_actions) > 1 then
  722.             fatal "Options -c -o are incompatible with compiling multiple files"
  723.         end;
  724.   end;
  725.   if !make_archive && List.exists (function
  726.       | ProcessOtherFile name -> Filename.check_suffix name ".cmxa"
  727.       | _ -> false) !deferred_actions then
  728.     fatal "Option -a cannot be used with .cmxa input files.";
  729.   List.iter (process_action env) (List.rev !deferred_actions);
  730.   output_name := final_output_name;
  731.   stop_early :=
  732.     !compile_only ||
  733.     !print_types ||
  734.     match !stop_after with
  735.     | None -> false
  736.     | Some p -> Clflags.Compiler_pass.is_compilation_pass p

  738. (* This function is almost the same as [Arg.parse_expand], except
  739.    that [Arg.parse_expand] could not be used because it does not take a
  740.    reference for [arg_spec].
  741.    We use a marker \000 for Arg.parse_and_expand_argv_dynamic
  742.    so we can split out error message from usage options, because
  743.    it always concatenates
  744.    error message with usage options *)
  745. ‌let parse_arguments ?(current=ref 0) argv f program =
  746.     try
  747.       Arg.parse_and_expand_argv_dynamic current argv Clflags.arg_spec f "\000"
  748.     with
  749.     | Arg.Bad err_msg ->
  750.       let usage_msg = create_usage_msg program in
  751.       let err_msg = err_msg
  752.       |> String.split_on_char '\000'
  753.       |> List.hd
  754.       |> String.trim in
  755.       Printf.eprintf "%s\n%s\n" err_msg usage_msg;
  756.       raise (Exit_with_status 2)
  757.     | Arg.Help msg ->
  758.       let err_msg =
  759.         msg
  760.         |> String.split_on_char '\000'
  761.         |> String.concat "" in
  762.       let help_msg =
  763.         Printf.sprintf "Usage: %s <options> <files>\nOptions are:" program in
  764.       Printf.printf "%s\n%s" help_msg err_msg;
  765.       raise (Exit_with_status 0)
